channel.title: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?
channel.description:
Hello again,
I got my source, which is pretty much a dedicated PVP source. I wanted to know if I could easily take out the areas, or if it's harder than I think. The way I think of it is, is as the same way a NPC is spawned, by setting the coordinates. Is that the same for a PVP area? If so, how can I delete a specific area? For example, Varrock currently is all PVP, I would like to make it like normal RS.
Thanks.

item.title: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

The “isInPvP” method will be called on in numerous occasions, probably across several classes, therefore I recommend you do not completely remove it unless you can follow up on it and delete it everywhere it’s used.

The easiest option for you lies in here:

((coordY >= 3490) && (coordY <= 3493) && (coordX <= 2730) && (coordX >= 2721) || (coordY >= 3240) && (coordY <= 3246) && (coordX <= 3097) && (coordX >= 3088) || (coordY >= 3246) && (coordY <= 3256) && (coordX <= 3087) && (coordX >= 3075) || (coordY >= 3138) && (coordY <= 3176) && (coordX <= 2621) && (coordX >= 2579)|| (coordY >= 4674) && (coordY <= 4719) && (coordX <= 2295) && (coordX >= 2250) || (coordY >= 3138) && (coordY <= 3176) && (coordX <= 2621) && (coordX >= 2579)|| (coordY >= 9800) && (coordY <= 9870) && (coordX <= 3135) && (coordX >= 3085)|| (coordY >= 3482) && (coordY <= 3514) && (coordX <= 2774) && (coordX >= 2743) || (absX >= 2755 && absX <= 2760 && absY >= 3495 && absY <= 3501) || (absX >= 3089 && absX <= 3099 && absY >= 3488 && absY <= 3500))

Find the co-ordinates for your Varrock PVP zone in there and remove them. I’m sure you can handle that, there isn’t much more I can tell you here.

Read full topic
item.source: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?

item.title: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?
item.dc:creator: @M_And_W M And W
item.description:
@M_And_W wrote:

That top snippet you provided isn't complete, notice how there's 2 open { and only 1 closed }, leaving an extra one of those around is a common cause of 100 errors, so when you're deleting stuff keep an eye on that..

So… I should take off 2 of the close brackets? Sorry for wasting time haha.

Read full topic
item.source: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?

item.title: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

[quote=“M And W, post:5, topic:375383”] public boolean isInPvP(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) { if ((coordY >= 3490) && (coordY <= 3493) && (coordX <= 2730) && (coordX >= 2721) || (coordY >= 3240) && (coordY <= 3246) && (coordX <= 3097) && (coordX >= 3088) || (coordY >= 3246) && (coordY <= 3256) && (coordX <= 3087) && (coordX >= 3075) || (coordY >= 3138) && (coordY <= 3176) && (coordX <= 2621) && (coordX >= 2579)|| (coordY >= 4674) && (coordY <= 4719) && (coordX <= 2295) && (coordX >= 2250) || (coordY >= 3138) && (coordY <= 3176) && (coordX <= 2621) && (coordX >= 2579)|| (coordY >= 9800) && (coordY <= 9870) && (coordX <= 3135) && (coordX >= 3085)|| (coordY >= 3482) && (coordY <= 3514) && (coordX <= 2774) && (coordX >= 2743) || (absX >= 2755 && absX <= 2760 && absY >= 3495 && absY <= 3501) || (absX >= 3089 && absX <= 3099 && absY >= 3488 && absY <= 3500)) { return true; }[/quote]

That top snippet you provided isn’t complete, notice how there’s 2 open { and only 1 closed }, leaving an extra one of those around is a common cause of 100 errors, so when you’re deleting stuff keep an eye on that…

Read full topic

item.title: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?
item.dc:creator: @M_And_W M And W
item.description:
@M_And_W wrote:

[code=] public boolean isInPvP(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) { if ((coordY >= 3490) && (coordY <= 3493) && (coordX <= 2730) && (coordX >= 2721) || (coordY >= 3240) && (coordY <= 3246) && (coordX <= 3097) && (coordX >= 3088) || (coordY >= 3246) && (coordY <= 3256) && (coordX <= 3087) && (coordX >= 3075) || (coordY >= 3138) && (coordY <= 3176) && (coordX <= 2621) && (coordX >= 2579)|| (coordY >= 4674) && (coordY <= 4719) && (coordX <= 2295) && (coordX >= 2250) || (coordY >= 3138) && (coordY <= 3176) && (coordX <= 2621) && (coordX >= 2579)|| (coordY >= 9800) && (coordY <= 9870) && (coordX <= 3135) && (coordX >= 3085)|| (coordY >= 3482) && (coordY <= 3514) && (coordX <= 2774) && (coordX >= 2743) || (absX >= 2755 && absX <= 2760 && absY >= 3495 && absY <= 3501) || (absX >= 3089 && absX <= 3099 && absY >= 3488 && absY <= 3500)) { return true; }

AND

[code=]else {

if(isInPvP(absX, absY, 1)) {

if(secs == 0 && inCombat && deathStage == 0) {
pvpmode = true;

secs = 20;

int timed = secs/2;

if(multiCombat()) {
multitime = true;
outStream.createFrame(208);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197);
sendQuest("@or2@"+timed+"", 199);
} else {
multitime = false;
outStream.createFrame(208);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197);
sendQuest("@or1@"+timed+" ", 199);
}

} else {
if(secs == 0 && deathStage == 0) {
pvpmode = false;
setInterfaceWalkable(4535);
sendFrame126("@whi@ProjectScape ", 4536);
} else {

int timed = secs/2;

if(multiCombat()) {
multitime = true;
outStream.createFrame(208);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197);
sendQuest("@or2@"+timed+"", 199);
} else {
multitime = false;
outStream.createFrame(208);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197);
sendQuest("@or1@"+timed+" ", 199);
}
}
}

} else {
if(!isInPvP(absX, absY, 1)) {
pvpmode = true;
if(multiCombat()) {
multitime = true;
outStream.createFrame(208);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197);
sendQuest("@or2@ALL", 199);
} else {
multitime = false;
outStream.createFrame(208);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian_dup(197);
int lowerlevel = combatLevel - 25;
int higherlevel = combatLevel + 25;
if(higherlevel > 126) {
higherlevel = 126;
}
sendQuest("@or1@"+lowerlevel+" - “+higherlevel+” ", 199);
[/code]

I found these both. I took them out, and got 100 errors, so I put them back in lol.

Read full topic
item.source: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?

item.title: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

Well, a quick search of your previous posts seems to show your using delta…

That being the case, search client.java for:

public boolean isInWilderness

…should be in there, although the fact you mention it’s a dedicated PVP source means it could be under:

public boolean isInPvP

as was the case in servers such as “Cammy PVP”.

Once you find that, your essentially looking for:

(absX >= X1) && (absX <= X2) &&(absY >= Y1) && (absY <= Y2)

using my above picture as a key for the co-ordinates

Read full topic
item.source: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?

item.title: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?
item.dc:creator: @M_And_W M And W
item.description:
@M_And_W wrote:

[quote=“rova1, post:2, topic:375383”]Yes, you’re on the right track. However, a NPC is spawned at an exact co-ordinate (x,y), whereas a PVP zone is spread over a vast area, therefore you need to find where it begins (or ends).

It is done in a perfect square, with the co-ordinates marked from the south-western point to the north-eastern most point. Now the image below will give you a rough idea of what I’m referring to:

However, that is just a guess, you must keep walking till you find the south-western most spot that is still in PVP, then search that co-ordinate (client.java) and remove it - it will be linked with the north-eastern spot which you should also remove.

Hopefully this helps[/quote]

By any chance you wouldn’t happen to know the code for it? :\ I’m glad you posted that. It’s reassuring to know that I know sort of what I’m doing. :]

Read full topic
item.source: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?

item.title: PVP Areas? How to put them in, take them out?
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

Yes, you’re on the right track. However, a NPC is spawned at an exact co-ordinate (x,y), whereas a PVP zone is spread over a vast area, therefore you need to find where it begins (or ends).

It is done in a perfect square, with the co-ordinates marked from the south-western point to the north-eastern most point. Now the image below will give you a rough idea of what I’m referring to:

However, that is just a guess, you must keep walking till you find the south-western most spot that is still in PVP, then search that co-ordinate (client.java) and remove it - it will be linked with the north-eastern spot which you should also remove.

Hopefully this helps

Read full topic
